comments.body:
Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Great idea for a for more food that will add a little realism to the Minecraft world
Maybe this could be a job for the grindstone

The way I envision it, a grinder could turn cobblestone into gravel, and gravel into sand.
It should probably be powered either by redstone or fuel, and function with hoppers.

If more uses are wanted, it could grind flowers/ink sacs/bone meal/cocoa beans into dyes. Perhaps even sugar cane into sugar, bones into bone meal, blaze rods into blaze powder.

This legit would actually be nice.

 

And if it were to actually happen, it would need some iron, redstone, flint, sticks, and maybe a diamond (Diamond would be optional)as part of the recipe, and it would be powered by coal/charcoal.

 

Honestly though, more gravel, more flint, more arrows, making grinding out cobblestone seem worth it.

I totally agree that Cobblestone and any stone crafted stairs/slabs/walls should be grindable into gravel (if it worked like a furnace where it could funnel stuff in and create gravel, that would be great)!  And similarly, then you could also grind gravel finer down into sand which would make sand very renewable (not sure how it is any more fun for sand NOT to be renewable nor does having a renewable source of sand seem OP other than being able to build more with Glass which again seems like it would add fun rather than the feel bad of accidentally breaking valuable Glass or losing valuable Sand).  It could require diamonds or some other rare material in order to make if it feels unbalanced but doesn't seem any more unbalanced than turning wood into charcoal...  TNT can already be duped so that also shouldn't detract and most players aren't crafting tons of TNT in their single player worlds...
Or it could become charcoal instead.
Or it could be Gunpowder, or they could add a new, useless "Ashes" item.
It would be cool with the banner affect too, like you make your own design with the loom on the rug, because then you have the option too keep it plain if the player prefers it that way
I, personally, would like to see the addition of patterns put into carpet so the loom isn't just limited to banners. It would also apply to carpets as well.
Carpet patterns in the loom is something I would use all the time especially because of how hard it is to change the carpet textures on the bedrock edition
Good idea
Chalk is for school, not just any kind of ideas! This idea is cancelled or scrapped
Planning giant collaborative projects would be easier, eg planning a castle

Greetings from the year 2021, denizens of the near past. Another great use for chalk sticks would be navigation. You could mark which caves you've already explored completely or which ones lead back out. Also what if we could use glow ink sacks to make glow in the dark chalk markings.
An idea for this could be a command such as /jigsaw <starting-piece> [pos]
The player is way too heavy for the Chickens. Good idea though.
maybe it would take 5 percent of you damadge per chicken.
I LOVE that idea!!! I totally agree! But I think you need 20 or more chickens to make a parachute!
It  should also work with parrots and/or any entity with slow falling effect
please add this idea. It's so stupid it just might work. I love it.
Makes sense. These could possibly also found in structures.
Make sure to vote for yourself.
nice idea
They should also all get gates to go with the walls and regular doors.
Just because it has stone in the recipe doesn't mean it should turn mobs into stone.
what do you propose?
@PlasticHalo8458 I purpose that this idea should be reconstructed more logically and not something that was made from a pointless mod.
@PlasticHalo8458 I do see a little bit potential for this post but the way it's set up is just not right.
maybe it would be harder to make if you also needed 1 endstone.
Eric, I agree with u with the endstone but maybe us more gold as well as a diamond block
also it wouldnt work on boss mobs or players. if it is thrown at a player the playef will lose half of there inventory space and be very slow, and apear grey
That makes no sense! The boss mobs I can understand but for players that's just a super slowness arrow! Why would we even need this when players are a bigger threat then mobs?
becaue it dosnt make sense to mine the players. it would also take half there stuff, which would be dropped on the ground for you.
This is quiet a unique idea but a bit complicated

Agreed. Clay is such a nice building block, but unfortunately they're not renewable in Bedrock edition. In Java they're also hard to renew. My suggestion would be monster drops, perhaps from Husks or Silverfish.
As cool as this would be, Banners don't have the redstone capabilities so this wouldn't work. Great idea though.

@blast burner They can be given red stone capabilities though could they not? I mean when you craft a door there is no red stone involved in the process yet somehow they interact with it so the same could be done for banners maybe?
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360043261431-Banner-Wearing-Similar-to-Illager-Captain- (Another Banner related post)
Cool but a different motion than curl up because that suggest the forbidden shape. (Circles)

@EpicBboy123

I should have probably been more specific, the animation wouldn’t actually be curling up into a circle the banner would simply get a thicker oblong at the top when fully “curled”

Imagine the way a blind gets pulled up when you pull the string/chain, the blind gets shorter and the roll at the top would get longer, however in minecraft the roll would be replaced by an oblong.

Clouds are items.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
Ooooo. Mysterious.
you should be able to collect it to use it

Sorry but this is already a thing so you should go there and support them: Obsidian Shards.

Perhaps make the obsidian materials different for the shortsword.

This would be really cool! Bugs in Minecraft is a pretty awesome concept, and a net would be a great base for the addition of a bunch of friendly bugs in the future. I love bugs, so maybe this comment is a little biased, but bugs would add a lot to the immersive feeling in Minecraft.  A lightning bug in a bottle and some other bugs would be a fun way to light up a room.
I'm getting terraria vibes.

Would be useful for transporting the new bees, since they always spawn more than a day's hike away from wherever it is you set up shop, and abandon their nests periodically.

Maybe make it function with ender mites and silverfish too.

Really like this idea.Could collect bats and bees but also add butterflies who maybe allow you to craft something like a Banner or something
Bugs that teach you a recipie to dig quicker
carrying bees would be cool lol
This could also fit well with the addition of termites, not to mention potentially frogs as well!

I would like to expand on this idea because I have been thinking about it a lot since the announcement of the lightning bugs! So what I'm thinking is, when you left click while holding the net, it would pick up the bug. And you could do this and collect a bunch of bugs with the net. It would act kind of like the bundle as it will carry the bugs. And then you can right click to release them all at once in a spot. If you didn't want to release all of them, that's easy, just net up the ones you didn't want to release up again. I was thinking that you could net up fireflies and butterflies and other small bugs with the net.
this is a cool idea. you deserve more votes
I was about to suggest this too
That would be nice because I couldn’t find where mine teleported to
What if the egg respawns but only if the original no longer exists e.i in block form, item form or entity form.
YES but what about a 25% chance.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
This pairs nicely with the ability to do so with nylium and netherrack in the Nether

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
This could be another ore introduced in the nether update! A lot of players would like a red ore!

The scepter should be crafted with:3 sticks and
Tier 1:lapis lazuli
2:glowstone
3:ghast tear
4:ender eye
5:end crystal
6:nether star
And the mana bar doesn’t need nothing to exist but only appears when we take the scepter

I was thinking of a similar thing. My thought was the same as an ender chest but you could feed it and take from it with hoppers. The only restriction is only 2 could be placed in the world if you place a third the first one would despawn or break. Would be great for mining if you hooked it to your storage system or a bunch of chests in your base. Couldn't take stuff back out because it would be emptied by the hoppers but could go for a long time. Also for building if you put it under a storage silo for cobble or the other blocks you use and just be able to keep pulling until the silo is empty but then couldn't place into it because it would be kept full. Might be fun.

I've had a few ideas regarding this, but my favourite is probably the craziest.

What if you could jump into a nether chest and it would act like a portal, but instead of telleporting you between the nether and overworld, it would take you to a tiny, player specific pocket dimensions. The dimension could be around 10×10 and the walls would be unbreakable. You could build whatever you want in your dimension and use it like a tiny portable base/storage
Love you guys <3
Sorry but the Totem of Undying only saves you if you're at half a heart and the void kills you like crazy.

Yeah it is a feature of totems that they don't save you from the void. I can appreciate if you get knocked in whilst trying to fight the ender dragon it can be annoying, but it's just a part of the game :(

How much would the levitation last for?

 

If it's not that much then your dying either way.

So basically, you build the figurehead out of blocks, the rudder as far as I know is not, (I presume it to be crafted). Once the figure head is placed on the front of the block built boat and the rudder at the back your “boat” will turn into an entity that you can ride about upon the oceans?
that's right although as I said before im still on the fence of wether or not it needs to be loot like the saddle or if it could be crafted
That would be awesome have been hoping to build a functional ship in Minecraft for a long time been playing since before there was doors
WHAT Minecraft didn't have doors at one point!?!?!???
ships can really help you go across the sea
Moved to proper category.Thanks for your contribution.
I think that if you use the bell while there obviously no danger in the village, it should lower your popularity.
Iron Bars are not like fences.
I think they are similar enough.
